title: @Riot Repertoir: Please Clear Up the confusion, Our Math Skills Are Horrendous and it wont take long
body:
Plain and simple. 

Is the interaction between Jhin, and guinsoos rageblade bugged?  Or is it simply large numbers happening?  Im still not seeing any direct quotes on this, and its really becoming a clusterfawk in here about it.

**My math says you can hit 1k+ ad on basically any champion in the game with the item but id like to hear it straight from the horses mouth.  Thanks in advance!!**


**Edit: Personally confirmed  1636 attack damage on {{champion:16}} with sub optimal runes..... Im not seeing the bug unless its not jhin specific and in fact is guinsoos specific.**

replies.body: The extremely high amounts of AD are the results of different %amps acting recursively with each other. It's not an issue unique to Jhin, and there are other instances of recursive stat increases in the game, but it is certainly most pronounced on him. A change is already locked into the 8.9 to address this with Rageblade.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xL6mEm9M,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-26T21:14:45.266+0000)
>
> The extremely high amounts of AD are the results of different %amps acting recursively with each other. It's not an issue unique to Jhin, and there are other instances of recursive stat increases in the game, but it is certainly most pronounced on him. A change is already locked into the 8.9 to address this with Rageblade.

Thanks!! And much love as always!!!

Strictly speaking that doesn't address if it's a bug or 'large numbers happening'.

My interpretation is that the recursion is(/was) intended behavior (since as you say, it exists elsewhere), and so not technically a bug. However, the potential strength of it may not have been foreseen, and it's such that it's going to be changed to be non-recursive, however this is simply a nerf rather than a bug fix. 

The other possible interpretation is that the recursion occurring is itself a bug that wasn't supposed to happen, on jhin or otherwise.

Not that it makes any practical difference, but theres been people arguing past each other with "Rageblade jhin is bugged to give excessive numbers" "No, rageblade jhin is just really strong, but the math checks out" "No it's a bug, no way that's intended" etc. and it'd be nice to put such an argument to bed.  (Although I suppose where the change is listed in the patch notes might address it.)

The interaction between Rageblade and Jhin is working just fine.

The issue is, they don't want it to work like that.

When they reworked Rageblade, they kinda forgot that bonus %AS and %AD might be a problem, since one champion directly scales from bonus %AS and %AD.
Thanks!

Why wasn't this put into 8.8 or hotfixed on 8.7? Even Vlad 1 patch after rework got this bugged fixed.

Serious lack of accountability on this.

Because it's not actually as bad as you're making it seem? lol

it takes him 6 shots to stack and he only gets 4 before he has to reload, he needs 4+ items for it to be effective, if he needs to ult he has to drop all those stacks, and he's still a 550 range marksman with no mobility

by the time he meets all those conditions, Twitch, Tristana, Caitlyn, or even Jinx would have mowed down his entire team from 1000 range, or Xayah kills him with feathers, or Kai'Sa shows up behind him and 1-shots him before melting the rest of his team

yeah but it's not just him. I've seen Dravens throw it into their build, Varus runs rampant with it (Even as a Varus main, I'll admit the item makes him too strong. Jax demolishing anyone near him with it. The item is too strong, that's all there is to it.
Varus ran it even before the change and has run it this entire time for a completely different reason.
Yeah for sure, but that doesn't mean it isn't a busted item. I'm not saying that Varus is OP, I'm saying the item is OP.
these changes will make no difference to varus or draven as they have no multipliers in their kits? it may make them slightly weaker with infernals but thats all i can think off.
This issue with Rageblade actually is just him. His passive and Rageblade stack AD recursively. It's working as expected for the other champs you named.

plain wrong bro, master yi gets more ad based on the ad he already has

I wouldn't say he has 0 mobility, at 3 items Jhin is pretty much permanently going to be at like 600 MS whenever he shoots. But I completely agree on everything else. Yeah reaching 1k+ AD on a champion that late game crits every AA seems broken, but the enemy team late game is usually dead before this happens.

(Numbers are not exact, only for illustrative purposes)
In house say they have 100 testers working 40 hours/week for a month for every patch. >16,000 work hours total to test the totality of the changes.
Patch goes live, say a quarter of a million players are online. In _one hour_ they do 250,000 work hours of testing.

No contest. (You can tweak the numbers all you want, even with the PBE, the Live numbers will always dwarf the testing numbers)

The in house team focuses on what might be trouble areas, and a few general passes. And a good chunk of that is repeat testing on iterations that didn't work.
From here forward though, they will likely keep a closer eye on Jhin and any future % damage/AS items/changes.
How does it work? Is the change a way to add % bonus to bonus ad from items alone or is it something else?

It and his passive keep granting incresed stats.

Rageblad sees stats, grants more. Jhin passive sees new stats, grants more! Rageblade sees these new stats and give more!

At least that's basically how it was explained previously.
So basically it's as if Vlad's passive didn't say "This effect does not stack with itself"?

Kind of. Jhin's main problem on the item is that it gives A LOT of AS for his passive to work with with while also giving really big % numbers to work with. Each stack doesn't actually ADD anything besides the AS to increase his passive. The bug with Jhin is probably how they want the passive %ad amp and rageblade %ad amp to work together. It will still PROBABLY be worth buying on him late game after the changes depending on how they work together since 1000 AD would probably still be in the ballpark with the item (as opposed to stuff like 1400).

Vlad's passive problem is the fact that without that clause his passive would actually give him NEAR infinite health and AP by itself. Due to rounding you can't actually reach "infinite" since the bonus would eventually reach below 0.5 AP/HP based on constantly reapplying the % on itself (which is why 2 Zed's ulting each other will never reach infinite AD since the bonus you get will soon be sub 0.5 AD), but you would still reach an absurd hp/ap value before that becomes the case.

currently the bonus % ap stacks **additively** with dragon and rabadon's but his bonus % ad stacks **recursively** with dragon

It's not impossible, but it rewards good Nocturne play. It's actually harder to pull off than you think.

It affects his own Q instead more consistently. Adding 45 damage to it at rank 5.

So remember Vlad? If Vlad buys HP he gets AP and if he buys AP he gets HP. However the HP you get from buying AP can not give you AP. If it did, this would be recursive. Jhin's passive is recursive.

Passive increases his bonus AD by a percentage, rageblade increases AD by a percentage. His passive sees some bonus AD and gives him some more based off it; rageblade sees that bonus AD and gives him some more based off it; passive sees THAT bonus AD and...

That happens in a loop infinitely until the number gets small enoughl that the game rounds it down to zero.
